definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: The women model workers actively participate in local politics.
sentences.chinese: 这些女劳模积极参与当地政治。

sentences.english: The wealth of the enterprise model worker is the main force of enterprise security products.
sentences.chinese: 劳模是企业的财富，是企业安全生产的主力军。

sentences.english: They held a party in honour of the model workers.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行了一场晚会来向劳模们表示敬意。

sentences.english: In a word, we should learn from him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一名劳模，我们应该向他学习。

sentences.english: I played against Ferrer, I played against Davydenko in the French Open.
sentences.chinese: 我打过费雷，法网对阵劳模。

sentences.english: On what he'll do with the prize money: "I want to buy apartment still."
sentences.chinese: 上面是劳模答记者问，谁说拿了奖金急着买房啦？

definition: brave man, willing to risk his life
family firm producing a special product/cottage industry
to be dedicated to one's work/to respect one's work
parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes)/example/model/pacesetter
Lei Feng (1940-1962), made into a model of altruism and dedication to the Party by propaganda from 1963 onwards
